meanings.definition: To convert or be converted into carbon
meanings.sent1: When you heat wood for a long time, it carbonizes and turns into charcoal.
meanings.sent2: The fire slowly carbonizes the wood, changing its structure.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left the toast in the toaster too long, and it carbonized into a blackened mess!
meanings.sent4: The intense heat of the sun can carbonize the surface of rocks over time.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption was so hot that it carbonized everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To char or burn (organic matter) so as to leave a carbon residue
meanings.sent1: The chef carefully carbonizes the vegetables on the grill to give them a smoky flavor.
meanings.sent2: The bonfire quickly carbonizes the marshmallows, turning them golden brown.
meanings.sent3: The campfire got out of control and carbonized the hot dogs to a crisp!
meanings.sent4: The blacksmith's forge can carbonize metal, making it stronger and more durable.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire spread rapidly, carbonizing everything in its path.
